content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.

parts:
Parent Question: I would like my child to stop tuition class for the holidays and resume only next year.

Tuition centre response: We do allow students to stop for up to 4 lessons in total during school holidays. If its longer, unfortunately the main office will not hold the class spot for them. So if their current class fills up, they may have to join a different class timing or different teacher when they come back.

Make the tuition center response more friendly and congenial.

Sure! Here’s a friendlier and more congenial version of the tuition center's response:

---

Thank you for reaching out! We completely understand the desire to take a break during the holidays. We do allow students to pause for up to 4 lessons during this time, so your child can enjoy their break without any worries. If you decide to take a longer break, please keep in mind that while we’ll do our best to accommodate your return, there’s a chance that their current class might fill up. In that case, we may need to find a different class time or teacher when they come back. 

We appreciate your understanding, and we look forward to welcoming your child back next year!

--- 

Feel free to adjust any part if you need it to be more tailored!
